meanings.definition: Covered in scribbles or messy writing.
meanings.sent1: The notebook looked scribbly with all the messy notes.
meanings.sent2: Her scribbly handwriting made it hard to read the letter.
meanings.sent3: The cat left a scribbly trail of paw prints in the wet paint.
meanings.sent4: The forest was a scribbly mess of branches against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The artist's canvas was filled with colorful, scribbly lines.

meanings.definition: Characterized by hasty or careless writing.
meanings.sent1: His scribbly signature on the contract showed his haste.
meanings.sent2: The rushed note was scribbly and barely legible.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's scribbly corrections made the students giggle.
meanings.sent4: The scribbly lines on the map led them astray in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The scribbly message on the board left everyone confused.

meanings.sent1: She doodled a quick scribbly on the corner of the page.
meanings.sent2: The child's scribbly on the wall was a masterpiece in their eyes.
meanings.sent3: The artist's cat made a scribbly with its tail in the spilled paint.
meanings.sent4: The scribbly on the whiteboard looked like a mysterious code.
meanings.sent5: The scribbly in the margins of the book added a touch of whimsy.
